column4: run this script and pastebin all the ext.http://bootinfoscript.sourceforge.net/
your missing vista the script it may be as simple a a sudo update-grub in a Ubuntu terminal, put the HD" in the bios as sdc then sdb the sdc with the other entries.
the vista boot stanza is missing it apperas to be there though.
have you run a update-gru from Ubuntu, and has the vista ever run since the ubuntu install? and how did you resize the vista for installing the ubuntu? three questions here.
yes I ran from Ubuntu, I don't have vista, just ubuntu on this hdd and win7 on another hdd. win7 runs just fine if I change the hdd boot order on bios
do you have the bios reading the hd's in this order, sdc then sdb then sda last. You have a ms bootloader in the mbr of the sda HD it may be that grub is going there rather then the sdb mbr.
in bios i have sdc1 first (ubuntu), sdb1 (win7) and I believe sda1 (just for backups, formatted as ntfs)

I will look closer at the script myself but it may be that the sdb drive needs a chkdsk run grub is kind of picky in this area. worse case here you could leave t as is except using easybcd to boot Ubuntu , this would have the sdb before sdc in the bios.
you know how to run a chkdsk /f/r on the vista I presume.
cool I never used esybcd until testerday when I installed XP on a hd reading as W7 an extended with 3 Ubuntu, then the XP in  primary. I have grub2 boot to W7 now which gives me a choice of W7 or XP.
ill run chkdsk and try easybcd

I was surprised at how easy easybcd was it read the Ubuntu grub2 with know problem and brought me to my main grub2 menu, I do have the XP showing in the grub2 menu but it at tis point wont boot with the W7 being the acxtive=boot flag partition, but easybcd boots t.
I hope it will do it, thanks for all the help
if it doesnt, ill just boot by switching the order in bios, I only use ubuntu for dev
there is a post bios menu you can choose rather then changing the bios per-session mine is f12, your may be different
I gotta check that, I'm a bit outdated with computer stuff
may be esc, or an f key, or even two keys but probably one. I think it is f8.
